title: 107_s1474
content: The Act may be cited as the "Pesticide Maintenance Fees Reauthorization Act" and includes provisions for maintenance fees. The "Pesticide Maintenance Fees Reauthorization Act" amends the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act by adjusting registration fees to $2,300 per year and increasing other fee amounts. The Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act is amended to increase fees to $20,000,000 for fiscal years 2002 through 2006 and redefine small businesses as those with global gross revenue from pesticides not exceeding $60,000,000. The Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act is amended to increase fees to $20,000,000 for fiscal years 2002 through 2006 and redefine small businesses as those with global gross revenue from pesticides not exceeding $60,000,000. Additionally, the authority under the Act is extended until 2006. SEC. 3. OTHER FEES amended to change the year from 2001 to 2006. SEC. 4. EXPEDITED PROCESSING OF SIMILAR APPLICATIONS. Section 4(k)(3) of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act is amended to review and evaluate inert ingredients and ensure expedited processing. The Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act is amended to ensure expedited processing and review of applications. SEC. 5. PESTICIDE TOLERANCE PROCESSING FEES. Section 408(m)(1) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to include provisions regarding pesticide tolerance processing fees. The Administrator is prohibited from creating regulations on pesticide tolerance processing fees from the date of enactment until September 30, 2006, with an exception for adjusting fees annually based on the Federal General Schedule pay scale.
